poem:
Title: "Fragments of Gaza"

Through the dust-kissed alleys, a deafening chime,
A mosaic of faces shatter in time.
Four souls rescued, yet hundreds bled,
The cost of a life, a price overhead.
274 echoes in history's crawl,
698 shadows where hope should fall.
The world roars, the world cries,
In Gaza's heart, humanity sighs.
Unheeded their wails, unheeded their pleas,
Fragments of Gaza, lost in the breeze.
